website_summaries.verdict: A lot of trail running enthusiasts were fascinated with the Gel Sonoma 2. They said that it performed well, that its cushioning system was agreeable, responsive and supportive. Appreciation was also given to its design, as well as its trail-ready outsole. Some even said that it worked well on both the trails and the roads. But, according to others, the durability of this trail shoe wasn’t up to the task. Apparently, the outsole and upper easily broke down on them.
pros: A runner wrote that the upper unit of the Asics Gel Sonoma 2 didn’t rub against their skin, thus preventing irritation and blistering
Many consumers stated that this shoe felt great right out of the box
the word ‘comfortable’ was used many times to describe their time wearing it
According to a number of runners, this shoe’s facade was visually appealing
The mid-sole unit was supportive enough to correct supinated foot-motion, a tester noted
The lugged outsole unit was able to provide sure surface traction, which made it easy for many testers to traverse the trails
The rubber compound used in the outsole did not wear off easily, according to those who have tried it
A lot of runners agreed that the price of this trail shoe was affordable
Some purchasers wrote that the Gel Sonoma 2 remained efficient & comfortable when used on the pavement
It felt lightweight, according to reviewers
cons: After a month of use, a runner noticed that a hole began to form on the lateral front section of the upper unit
The rubber material on the side started fraying, a tester noted

customer_reviews.title: Avoid unless you want extra ventilation!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these when they arrived. Great fit and extremely comfortable, but after exactly a year a hole has emerged in the mesh fabric. I have not worn these every day or even every week as they were bought for dog walking and in the winter I used wellies so certainly haven't worn them out by any means as the following photos will show. I always look after my things so no neglect on my part. First pair of Asics for me and will now be the last. Poor materials and very shoddy.
customer_reviews.author: Exmoor

customer_reviews.title: The grip is excellent on the terrain
customer_reviews.text: I've always been size 5 in a trainer but around 4-4.5 in a shoe. These fit perfectly. I have worn them twice now out in the forest. The grip is excellent on the terrain, even in slippery surfaces. Excellent comfort and support. I'm new to running in the forest and these for me are the prefect trainer.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Hole above toe after 2 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought on 9th May, it's now 12th July and there is a hole above the toe on the left foot. I've logged in to try and get them replaced but it says the window for return and replace closed in June. I'm really not pleased about this.
customer_reviews.author: PDiddy

customer_reviews.title: Solid and grippy
customer_reviews.text: Got these 2 days before a tough mudder so broke them in on the actual run. They were incredible - nice and sturdy so kept my foot/ankle in place the whole time and has good grip so I didn't slip all over the place. Clean easily enough. Wasn't looking to spend a fortune on a good pair of trail running shoes and these fit the bill perfectly. I have a narrow foot and usually wear a UK 6, ordered a UK 6 in these are they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great Trainers
customer_reviews.text: Great trainer, gives good support and lovely colours. Would recommend buying at least half size bigger as these are a tight fit because of all the support and cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Siodh

customer_reviews.title: Asics Gel-Sonoma 2
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. I wear a UK size 7, and these (UK 7, EU 40.5) were a perfect fit. Comfortable for both walking and running, with a good cushioned sole. Very stylish, with some fun detailing and bright colours. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. R.

customer_reviews.title: You need to buy in a bigger size
customer_reviews.text: Bought and love the colours. Put on and went out - half way round realised feet were getting quite sore. Regret not buying the next size up from my normal size.
customer_reviews.author: JennyB

customer_reviews.title: Loved these trainers when I got them
customer_reviews.text: Loved these trainers when I got them, really comfortable and looked good too. Unfortunately after 5 months I noticed some wear and tear around the top of the left shoe and now 6 months later they have 2 full holes, one above the toe on right foot and 1 on the upper of the left. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tore too fast
customer_reviews.text: Shoe tore in < 100 miles , loved the fit and comfort but the life is too short I am just 55 kgs and do only 6 miles per week.. proper road running
customer_reviews.author: Rakheedg

customer_reviews.title: buy 1-1.5 size bigger!
customer_reviews.text: Look very nice but buy I should order 1-1.5 size bigger than I actually wear, therefore I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Svet

customer_reviews.title: They fit like a glove and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wore these shoes on the day I got them ,no need to wear in.I wear them for walking.They fit like a glove and are very comfortable, just as expected.
customer_reviews.author: clare

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed fabric on front of the trainer started to fall ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed fabric on front of the trainer started to fall apart. Even tho I run I only do from 6-15k a week. Did expected them to last longer. Usually go for Nike but everyone recommended this make
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The right foot, rubs at the back and makes my ankle sore.
customer_reviews.author: Karen-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Look as good as new after many runs
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong 1 year later. Look as good as new after many runs. Size is generous no need to change size just that but more comfy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I feel disappointed to find no arch support 🙁
customer_reviews.text: I feel disappointed to find no arch support 🙁, overall look of trainer is nice. But I won't wear them to run
customer_reviews.author: jacqui

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Item received this morning. I am usually size 4.5/5 but I always pick size 5.5 for running shoes. These shoes fit perfectly. I haven't been running yet but I have been wearing them all morning and I am really pleased with my purchase. They're light and comfy. I wasn't sure about the color (they're flashier than what I would usually go for) but I actually really like it. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this make of trainer, especially for my nordic walking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic trainers
customer_reviews.text: These trainers are so comfortable. I've always worn Nike or Reebok but know I'm only going to buy these. They support your foot really well. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsty

product_meta.title: ASICS Women's Gel-Sonoma 2 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Hit the trails in the Asics women's Gel-Sonoma 2 trail running shoes. The shoes feature synthetic and nylon mesh uppers offer a great fit. This T684N-9078 features more cushioning than its predecessor thanks to a speva rear foot, while a rubberised midfoot trusstic offers support and stability. The addition of Asics high abrasion resistant (ahar) rubber also makes Gel-Sonoma 2 a durably robust trail shoe.
feature_bullets: Mesh structure - For breathability and a lightweight feel.
Synthetic leather overlays - Provides abrasion resistant properties and structural support.
California Slip Lasting - For stability and comfort. Upper is stitched around a canvas or EVA board and directly attached to the midsole.
SpEVA - Midsole cushioning compound that reduces forces upon the underfoot.
Forefoot GEL Cushioning System - Enhances shock attenuation during propulsion.
